page.title: 17Farm animals
page.content: The land is mainly arable and only 2 mixed farms remain. Horses; No more farm horses, but there is a stud farm for riding horses at Ladies Green. A few people keep horses for showing and riding. Cattle; About 70 fattening cattle are kept. Charolais, a French breed and Hereford and Fresian crosses. There are no dairy herds. Goats; A few for milk production. Sheep; One small flock for the production of lamb meat. A Suffolk- Border-Leicester cross. Pigs; Not any more a fattening pig in every cottage garden. No farm - scale pig units. Chickens; One flock of laying birds. Only a few kept as pets. Geese & ducks; not any more on a farm scale. Bees; Are used for pollinating fields with horse beans and rape seed. Pheasants; They are specialy bred for shooting, not as a source of food.
